nodes.bodyText: missing final
redundant empty line
We can use noneMatch here
I would also add or !pipelineRun.getStatus().isFinal()
Please, do not mutate input arguments, introduce a new variable instead. You can extract logic to determine actual region id to a separate method.
What is the goal of using one method for getOrCreate and delete operations? If there is no some issues with this, I'd prefer to split these methods on all layers.
We can make Route53Helper a bean to skip constructor call at every method call
Missing final or you can simply return client without local variable assignment
Let's call method getOrCreate to make it more clear
Missing final

I'd suggest to move dns method/methods to a new apiService and manager classes, as ClusterApiService mostly works with kubernetes cluster, except for instance offers (but is another topic to discuss).
Can't we use JsonMapper.parseData instead of creating a new mapper?
missing final
missing final
It seems that some code is duplicated with buildUrl method
Is ip enough here? If it is so, let's rename method to getEdgeIP
Please, do not use star imports in the source code
It is better to use CloudFacade here rather than directly call AWS implementation as run may be assigned to any of cloud regions.
Unused import
Do not use star imports
missing final
missing final
license year -> 2017-2020

nodes.bodyText: Let's use @Sl4j annotation instead of declaring a logger manually
To make logging more readable we can use log.info("Creating DNS record for hostedZoneid : {} record {}",  hostedZoneId, dnsRecord.getDnsRecord())
License year 2017-2020

nodes.bodyText: Missing final

At the moment this method will throw an error for all runs with service URLs if DNS settings are not configured. Can we at first check whether run uses custom DNS approach at first and only then check the settings?
Controller should use InfrastructureApiService not InfrastructureManager
Wrong message Deletion -> Creation
Wrong message Deletion -> Creation
With this approach plain endpoints are initialised only when all dns records will be created, so users will have to wait. Can we improve this?

nodes.bodyText:
I would propose not to throw any exceptions without handling them explicitly. I'm not sure enough how unhanded exceptions will affect threads in the pool. In order to avoid the worst scenario when a single failing endpoint prevents other endpoints from being processed I suggest to handle errors explicitly.
Of course If you've tested it and you are pretty confident that it is safe then I'm good too.

+                dns_record_create = os.path.join(api_url, API_POST_DNS_RECORD

nodes.bodyText:
Good point.
It should work fine, exception will be raised in the thread and shouldn't affect other threads, but I think it is better to explicitly catch it and just message log about it and quit from thread

nodes.bodyText: I wonder if it is safe to modify the same service_url_dict dictionary in multiple threads including the main one. Correct me if I'm wrong but this apply_async call just copies the arguments and therefore the dictionary in multiple threads is just not the same one anymore.
